intro: Cuatresia physocalycia, commonly known as the white-flowered cuatresia, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its stems are covered in soft, hairy tissue. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
